page.title: 17Treasure Trove at Pulham
page.content: Mr.S.Drake,a young man farming at Grange Farm,was checking one of his fields before drilling barley,when he turned up a coin which looked unusual. He washed it,made some enquiries and discovered he had found a "noble" _ a thin gold coin.During the next 6 months he dug up 95 nobles,2 half nobles and 3 quarter nobles.The British Museum confirmed that the coins dated from 1354(Edward III's reign) to 1434(Henry VI's reign) and were probably buried in 1434.After some delay the Treasure Trove was deemed to belong to the man who had dug it up and on whose land it was found.In 1985 the coins fetched Â£63,000 at auction _ a very lucky day for Mr. Drake!
